values:
I spent last night on the roof of the building looking at the moon.
This is no normal feat, mind.  Not only did it involve me picking the lock on the door to the roof (breaking and exiting?), but it's 7 1/2 stories high, incredibly windy, no guard rails at all... and did I mention that I'm deathly afraid of heights?  Why I went up there, I'll never know. I do now know that my lock picking skills are rusty and in desperate need of practice.

Anyways, that's not the point of this post

Usenet!

For all your pirating needs when you are behind an incredibly restrictive firewall.

Usenet!

Now, am I a geek for knowing how to utilize newsgroup to it's pirating fullest or for knowing it exists?

now if only I can finish my current downloads of Ah! My Goddess (the manga, I got the anime), I'll be happy

later

He who must not be sane

I feel proud.

I've started a trend around here.

People are pirating more in this town.

I'm like the captain of this pirate crew. I convinced people that piracy is good.

Arrrrgh

I'm sitting here, on the pc. My cat is standing on my legs, with her claws dug in, rubbing her head against the chair. I'm in terrific pain.

Anyways, I'm rather bored. 

Some could say, Superbored, but I hate throwing the word Super out there if there isn't a cape involved.

Did I ever mention that I'm allergic to cats. Particularly cat scratches. Every one of them puffs up rather largely.

My sanity keeps slipping in this realm. Perhaps I was not meant to be on this plane of existance.  I hear Olympus is nice this time of millenium, maybe I should go be a god.  The Olympian god of games and electronics.  probably have to change my name to something lame though, so not gonna happen.  I'd go to Asgard, but between Thor and Loki and all those other wacky deities, I'd be left out. 

can you tell that I'm bored yet?

what's with the 80s nostalgia now a days? The 80s weren't that great. C'mon. Mr. T... Alf... Even currently, with 80s cartoons so hot in the comic scene, really, if you go back and watch some of the 80s cartoons... they're lame. You want a list of lame 80s cartoons? how about, oh, we'll start with voltron. Voltron was a lame cartoon.  5 teenagers, piloting lion mecha which form a robot with the worst dialog ever encountered.  how about some rare ones? Bravestar and Jayce and the Wheeled Warriors. One's about a native american sheriff on an alien planet that resembles the old west, while the other is about one man's quest to destroy these giant talking plants... he should've just used a little diesel fuel, shoulda cleared 'em right up.  

ok, I'm making little sense to me, time to stop the delusions and hit the bed. Then possible lay in it and sleep, I'm not sure yet.

later

You Are 76% American
You're as American as red meat and shooting ranges. Tough and independent, you think big. You love everything about the US, wrong or right. And anyone who criticizes your home better not do it in front of you!
How American Are You?
k... now for the "great" news Due to the way our country handles student loans, in order for me to have my unsubsidized loan this year, my parents had to be denied a loan. For 3 years they've been denied. This year, they were approved. I'm waiting on some people at the bank for a private loan, but things aren't looking good. Second, I've been sick lately. Really sick. I know my blood sugar is high, but until tests are performed I do not know if I have diabetes or not. Both parents are diabetics. I blame their genes. so, all in all... life sucks, then you die. some die earlier than most. did I mention my birthday is 12 days away? some people get cars or other big presents when they turn 21... I get an illness.. yay me. And, I'm gone

meeeow indeed so... now that that's out of the way. school is rapidly approaching it's end for this academic year. 2 more weeks and I'll be home. let's not talk about that. the damn sun pisses me off. it wakes me early in the morning when I'm up till 4 am. it's too bright. I know it's necessary for life to exist, but does it have to shine into my room? I finished the fourth book in the Sword of Truth series, Temple of the Winds. Needless to say, Terry Goodkind is a genius and a bastard. I love the way he writes. Each book is a complete story. There are hints to what has happened before, and a clue of some bad circumstance to what is about to occur in the next book. This means that to satiate my mental craving I must read all of the books. I'm tired. Not tired in the since that I want to go to bed. Not physically worn out. But I'm tired nonetheless. Hard to explain. I'm tired. For some reason unknown to me, I have not been as depressed as usual. Perhaps I have finally accepted that the fate of my college career might be in jeopardy. Perhaps I have just hit the bottom and have no where to go but up. I do not know. Also, with the summer coming, I find that I feel alone. That's the bad part of going home. Everyone I know has someone. I have no one. Oh well, I'm used to it. Now, I am off to waste my day and game tonight. Forever idle, Shawn

My life is worse than I thought.

Bring It On Again is on USA Network...

I'm watching it...

and I might be enjoying it.

Could be cause there are some decent looking chicks in it.

but I still feel dirty.

Now I am off to see the wizard. The Wonderful Wizard of Oz.

Sanity? what's that?

I'm depressed.  Couldn't tell you why.  Hell, if I could tell myself why, I wouldn't be depressed.  Life sucks. I'm flunking classes that are vital to my future at Northwest Missouri State.

I'm tired. I'm depressed. My back hurts. I have a terrible headache. I have a test tomorrow as well as on Friday.

and the worst part of all...

I'm whining about it on a livejournal.

goodbye

This week is utter crap... and it's tuesday...

<stolen from a little witch :P>
1. Your real name: Shawn

2. Friends call you: Shawn, asshole, bastard, min/maxing-whore, Draco

3 What your girlfriend/boyfriend calls you: n/a

4 What's a name you once wished you'd rather have?: Sonny Morita, Man of Action (yes, it's the combination of two asian actors, but with their combined powers I'd be unstoppable mwahahahahaha!)

5. What is/are the ugliest name(s) you can think of?: no name is ugly, it depends on the culture of the person in question.

6. What would you name these if you had them as pets?
a. turtle: Raphael
b. goose: Dinner
c. pirate: why would I have a pirate as a pet?

7. If there was a song about you, what would it be called?: You're a Min/Maxing Whore, a hard rock song performed by one of the 80's Hair Bands.

8. What would you name your kids?:
Boy - Alexander
Girl - Lorelei (to those who know someone else by this name, it is NOT based on her... I just like the name)

9. What would you name a ship you built?: Tim

10. If you wrote a book, what would it be called?: 3rd Edition Dungeons & Dragons <STRIKE>for Dummies</STRIKE> Players Guide


Have you ever...
11. Thrown up in public?: Yup

12. Eaten or drank anything spoiled?: Yup

13. Had a rip in your pants you didn't know about?: That I didn't know about?  No

14. Tripped while checking someone out?: Nope

15. Had to pay for something you broke?: Are you assuming I break things?

16. Nearly drowned?: Yup

17. Passed out?: Multiple times

18. Had a crush on somebody: I think we all have

19. Been stuck in the rain?: You are never stuck in the rain. As a human being, your body will not be affected by a little water.

20. Been attacked by an animal?: yup

21. Caught people having sex?: yup.... two different roomates

22. Fallen asleep while driving?: Yup

23. Felt attracted to someone of the same sex?: Nope

24. Actually slipped on a banana peel?: yup

25. Made a wish that came true?: When you wish upon a star, there's no difference who you are..... ok, so no, I haven't won the lottery yet.


Complete The Sentence
26. I once had a dream... that I was destroying tokyo in a mecha

27. I'm only racist towards... racists

28. I don't even know why I'm... considered sane

29. I'd give anything to have sex with... you want a list? I don't have that kind of time

30. Nothing sucks more than having to... flunk out of school, be 6 hours from anyone up here, and not having a way to return.... ever...

31. If I had six bucks i'd buy... probably a soda and some laundry services

32. It's hot. I should take off my... hat

33. It's always more fun if you... have friends along

34. You can't eat steak without... chewing

35. You better shut up before I... destroy your family tree, starting at the current root and working my way down.

36. I really like you and everything but... you need to quit stalking me, bitch. (only happened once)


What would you do if...
40. A dirty old guy at the airport slaps your ass?: If you break a dirty old guy's neck in an airport, does he make a sound?

41. Somebody was about to steal your car?: Let them have it. It'll prolly get about 3 miles before the engine seizes up.

42. You wake up with a billion spiders crawling all over you and your bed? I'd wonder why there were that many spiders on the second floor of this dorm.

43. You farted while giving a persuasive speech in class?: Destroy tokyo

44. The person you just kissed tells you they have oral herpes?: See the doc.

45. You have three wishes?: $1.6 Billion dollars that are transformed from the air not 'borrowed' from someone else, the ability to emulate the abilities of any particular comic book character at will, and the ability to control afformentioned ability completely.

46. The government allowed you to choose one thing to be made illegal and one thing to be legalized?: Illegal: stupidity. Legal: My plan for eliminating stupidity.

47. Britney Spears was at your front door asking for jumper cables?: Ritualistic Sacrifice

48. You had a time machine?: be considered a god to many of the ancient races, some of the more modern races, and return to live as ruler of the planet.

49. FOX gave you a half hour show to do whatever you wanted?: It would be a fifteen minutes of static followed by things that would make porn stars blush. (use your imagination... I dare you... nope, you're wrong try again... still wrong... ok I think you got it now, but you don't...)

Would you rather....
50. Would you rather find the cure for cancer or the cure for aids?: Cancer. 

51. Would you rather have the power to fly, or the power to teleport?: Teleport.

52. Would you rather have the power to see the future, or the power to record your dreams?: Neither. Precognition would drive me insane, and nobody, not even me, wants to see what's in my dreams.

53. Would you rather be really skinny, or really fat?: I am really fat. I find that fat people enjoy the little things in life more than thin people.  For example, twice in the past month I have just sat and watched the effects of the sunset on the sky and clouds.

54. Would you rather be lost in a forest, or stuck in a box?: in a forest... it's got to be a big, sturdy box for me to get stuck in.

55. Would you rather be in a drama movie, or a comedy?: Comedy

56. Would you rather be in a hip hop video or a rock video?: Country

57. Would you rather have your birthday on Christmas Day, or on February 29th?: Christmas

58. Would you rather live in the sewer, or in Afghanistan?: sewer. at least in an American sewer your civil liberties are not repressed.

59. Would you rather be in a mental institution or in a penitentiary?: Mental Institution.

60. Would you rather snow board or hang glide: snow board. I have a fear of heights

61. Would you rather be a ninja or a pirate?: Ninja is an overated profession.  My nature is towards the sea to pillage, pluder, and perform sea chanties.

76. Were you too scared to do it?: nope

77. Who or what is your worst enemy?: Richard Simmons

78. Who is the last person you kicked?: kicked? I don't know. Punched? Jason... or James... or Chris... or Twiggles... hell I don't remember.

79. If you had to be a chess piece, which piece would you be?: Knight

80. Name three people you know whose names begin with the first letter of your last name: Bob, Brad, Blake

Greetings boys, girls, and adoring fans (of which I *might* have a grand total of 3). It's sunday. no classes tomorrow, but we are planning on going to St. Joseph to watch Hero, starring Jet Li. I've got a great parking spot, so I hesitate to move my car, even though the majority of collegiates have left for the long weekend. I'm just bored. Even the Food Network is letting me down. There is just so much Bobbie Flay that a man can stand. Perhaps I should dig up some anime or just read comics. As most people who read this journal, all 3 of you, know, when I get bored, I post stupid quizzes and junk. Thus, that is what I am doing. Enjoy, or don't. I don't care.

Design your own hell

I hate phones, but then again I just hate talking to people. It's pretty much due to a speech impediment from when I was younger that my brain's never gotten over, and add the massive amount of shyness I have.  I know what you're thinking. Me? Shy? Well believe it or not, I am. 

As anyone who knows me knows, I am not a small person. Last time I checked I was 350+ lbs.  All my life people have been making fun of my weight, and a few have been scared by it, so there wasn't a lot of room for social interactions.  Besides, I was happier just reading my books than spreading the latest gossip of the school. It affected me, but not in the stereotypical "everyone is making fun of me, I need to shoot myself" way.  I don't care if people comment about my weight, I really don't, but my mind has interpreted all of that trauma, plus the other traumatic events in my life, and makes it hard for me to vocally express my opinions.  I'm often stumbling over words and making symantic errors, and have done so for years.  I've learned to just stay quiet until I have something to say, and then I'm usually called "antisocial" or worse.  I am slowly becoming more social, but it's only apparent to my friends and "family" (I consider the marching band to be a family, I see them more than I see my own.)

Phones are one of the worst things for me, because you have to speak, and can't just listen.

Online's different though.  If I make a mistake online, I can just erase it and write something else.  Plus I'm never worrying if I'm saying the right thing, because it can be easily cleared up if there's any confusion.  I don't know why, but I can talk more openly online than in "real life."  Zephyr can agree with that.  Maybe it's the feeling that I can just go away for awhile if I screw up, or maybe it's that most of my social interaction experience, outside of gaming, is online.  I don't know.

Monday night vampire was last night, and the beloved "evil" presence returned to wreck havok on an unsuspecting ST. He expected us to disable a ship the following night, when there would be guards and snipers waiting. No, being the undead assholes we are, took explosives underneath the water and blew a hole in the bottom of the hull... Then, while I distracted the cops and then celeritied my ass out of there, they unloaded the cargo... a big heavy box. So big that the water was the only thing that let them move it. When we finally got this thing to where we could analyze it, we found that it was a block of concrete, with a staked vampire inside. Joy. Using a contact with Path of Blood, we analyzed a sample. It was a 5th gen Catiff who was a whole lot of diablerie. We left him in the basement of the science building of the University of Chicago. That's when "evil" started giving the ST the note. While he was alone, he used blood from the Catiff to create a diablarie chain, embracing 2 students using blood from the elder, so the two students were 6th gen... "evil" was 8th gen... he diblarized both students, raising him to 6th gen... higher than the prince, he also tried to start a 2-step blood bond with the catiff. My character let the prince know what he knows (nothin' about diablarie, just about the catiff) We then succeded in our mission for the prince, and major kudos were given. "Evil" will pay for overpowering the game. The ST will make him pay. The Camerilla doesn't like diablarie... the Tremere, "evil's" clan, doesn't like diablarie... I smell a blood hunt comin' on. Also, the Catiff was awakened by the prince and others, and because the ST trusts me he told me that the catiff elder was unbondable... Fun times shall ensue... Anyway, I feel like shit. I have a cold, and so does my roomate. He's whinin' because he doesn't normally get sick, and isn't used to something like this... I'm sick at least once a month, sometimes more, so I know what to expect. I also have this enormous toothache... life could be worse It's f-in' freezin' here... currently it's 1 degree F... wind chill -9... out on the tundra windtunnel?... prolly windchill -11 or lower. BLEH!!!! Who ordered this cold weather? They need to be found, shot, gutted, and have there heart sacrificed to Helios, the god of the sun. I'm done for now... it's too cold.. Laters

Java is a vile computer curse first implemented by Satan and his minions, Sun Microsystems, to destroy the minds of programmers, and torture the masses.

Now that that's out of the way.

My Monday nights are currently filled with a tabletop Vampire: the Masquerade game ran by my favorite scottish pirate (http://info.nwmissouri.edu/~fot/neochicago/index.html for more info on the campaign).  In the first game (last week), the PC's consisted of me, a guy named steve, and an "evil" man.  I am playing a brujah blues musician who runs a bar in downtown Chicago, Steve is a malkavian with MPD, but his other mind is gangrel(he even has protean), and "evil" is a Tremere with the Path of Conjuring.  Our intrepid trio went Sabbat hunting and successfully torpored to sabbat brujah and ashed another. Unfortunately the Malkavian torpored as well.

Last Monday we picked up a few more players, Little Chris and the Tuba man, both PhiMuAlphaSinfonia members(so's steve and the ST), and "evil" wasn't there, so it was me and the n00bs :)  The Tuba man is playing a Nos, while Little Chris played a Gangrel... yes, past tense.  We fought a city gangrel and our gangrel failed to soak the agg.  Anyway, the prince, after seeing the mass of sabbat bodies we were accumulating and dropping off at elysium (his house), he sent us on a mission to take out a powerful Sabbat attemting to regroup a force to take down Chicago.  First thing I did was ask the Nos if he could perhaps use his resources to find info on this Sabbat member, and he set up a meeting at hooters the next night(the ST likes that kind of thing).  Later that evening, while at my bar(blood on tap, $23 a glass, $65 a winebottle), a member of the undead that was unknown to me(LittleChris's new character) started asking me questions, and I was a total ass.  But, he did come up to me and almost broke the masquerade (if he had lived in Chicago, he would have seen a billboard of my bar and known who I was), and he also argued with my bartender to try to order blood. I thought nothing of it and went on stage (my bar and I play a mean blues guitar).  The next night the three of us who were given the mission from the prince went to hooters.  We met with a nossie and he told us that the nos would give us information if we delayed a certain ship from sailing the next day.  He also said it would be worth our while if we happen to commandeer a certain box in the cargo hold, measured 8x3x3. With those measurements, the first words out of my box was,"Who's in the box?"  The nossie said it wasn't our concern and we agreed to try to do what he asked, but made no promises.  On our way out, my character spotted the guy from his bar.  Walking behind him, he said "What are you doing here?"  He said something that included the word kindred and I had the malk restrain him as I said to the manager that he was a mental patient in the asylum gone mad by the vanishing of his wife, (believable since there had been known vanishings).  The three of us got him outside an into an alley way, where I pushed him against a wall and started asking him questions, why he was following me, what he had heard, why I shouldn't kill him...  After actually conferring with my allies, they said not to hurt him and I went with the majority (but me and the gangrel(littleChris's new character is a gangrel as well) had some great roleplaying and I started getting him to think incharacter).  We went to scout out the dock and ended the game for the night.

Steve and the Tubaman are really passive players.  I know it's their first time, but they are just following what my character is saying even if he's wrong.  LittleChris is a good sport about everything, but I really was an ass with him and it was mainly because I knew he could take it since the two of us have faced the ST's D&D's world with nothing but our wits(or lack there of), my divine spells, and our swords; no help from anyone else.  I'm mainly seeing how far I can push his personality so it develops more.

As much as I like "evil" and the stuff he comes up with, he can be kind of intimidating to new players when he's a pc.  He still intimidates me sometimes.  I'm kind of glad he wasn't there this week, or things would have beed different. Chris's old character would have lived, and it was really too weak to survive the WoD. For god's sake, Chris was playing a canadian game warden.  While not a bad concept, he didn't know the character creation rules to fully accomplish what he was trying to do.  He'll learn, they all will.

In other gaming news, the homophobic man who shares my first name is going to run DC Heroes, after a little ocnvincing by "evil" and myself.  I'm the only one in maryville with the book :)  "evil" is playing a sorceror, I'm playing a psionicist, and Twig's girlfriend, we'll call her "fruffy" for lack of a better term, is playing an alien that looks a lot like a watered down fae.  I need to majorly rework my character or we'll all die... we need some good defense.   Any suggestions would be appreciated but I doubt any of my readers know the system.

As I sit here and listen to a lesson on java, I only wonder.
Wonder why Satan unleashed this powerful force of evil throughout our world

Crappy new year everyone. It's a typical day in my house today. Dad's talking about how he's going to die in the upcoming months (he's been saying the same exact things for five or six years). My brother, who "hasn't moved out" but never comes home graced us with his presence, only to try to pull the same shit with me as always. My mom says she's going to run away and not come back, using my car. And there's me. Not only do I have to burn cd's for them today, be the "perfect" son, and take my brother's abuse, but I also have to have a "cheery" attitude all day. I hope you people know better. I haven't had a cheery attitude since I was in elementary school, if even then. 8 days till I leave for the 'ville, and I can't wait. I say I have to take my brother's abuse, let me clarify. I am a pacifist. I practice martial arts, and have been known to "keep the peace" at local drinking establishments on occasion, but I hate violence. My way of coping with the world is based on self control. How does this relate to my brother? Well, he is the opposite. He thinks he knows martial arts, he likes to cause violence, he has no control, he has no willpower. I will not fight him with my full strength when he attacks me, because I would seriously hurt him. I've been doing this for years, and he now thinks that I "can't hurt him." If he keeps pushing my buttons, I will send him to the emergency room. My family knows nothing about my livejournal, and I hope they ever find out. I have to vent my frustration in someway, and who knows what would happen if they found out my inner thoughts. Hell, I don't even want to know my inner thoughts, but I don't have that liberty. On an up note, presidential candidate Howard Dean has promised to raise the minumum wage from $5.15 to $7 if he's elected. Some right wing people in our nation say it would ruin our economy, but I'm not so sure.

the one-shot story will have to wait for another time, I have too much work to do In other news, somebody, besides Zephyr is reading my journal. It seems a person by the name of abstractlogic has put me on her friends list. If they are reading this, drop me a line. I like to meet my adoring fans :) but seriously, I have tons of stuff to do, so I don't know when I'll get back to my journal. only 12 more days and I'll be back in the 'ville

I ran a one-shot of Ninjas and Superspies (if anyone at Palladium ever reads this, Ninja has no plural form!!!!). It's a rpg produced by Palladium Games, the makers of the semi-popular Rifts, Heroes Unlimited, and even Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (don't laugh, I own a copy). Combat can take forever in a Palladium game, as first you roll to attack, then the opponent can roll to either dodge or parry. If the attack hits (any roll of 4 or above could be a successful hit if the opponent doesn't parry or block), damage is rolled, but the defender can still roll to roll with the punh/kick to take less damage. Damage is first done to the SDC, structural damage capacity, and when that drops to 0, hit points are affected. 0 hit points = death. Ninjas and Superspies (ok, from now on I'm going to call it NS, that way I won't have to kill myself over Palladium's grammar error) features several (over 35) different martial art styles which players can choose. It also has information on cybernetics and spy gadgets, but I'm not a fan, so we'll stick with the martial arts stuff. The players rolled up their characters (my old gaming group is kind of weird, so bare with me as I describe their characters. They started at 3rd level (which is pretty high in one of my worlds): Tyrese the Master of "Black-jitsu" (I'm not making this up, or trying to offend anybody) An African American that has been studying ju-jutsu since the early '70s and is stuck in the '70s. He sports an afro, black shades, and a bright yellow (we're talkin' canary yellow here) polyester disco suit, complete with platform shoes. Wang Lo Chi, Kung-Fu disciple The grandson of a Chinese immigrant, who learned the ancient arts from his grandfather. He practices both the Tiger and the Leopard styles of Kung-Fu and wears a simple kung fu suit. He's the quite one as well as the youngest at 19. and last, but not least Jade Tatsu (translation "Jade Dragon") The daughter of a Japanese business man, she practices ninjutsu. She is the only PC that will enjoy a good kill, as long as it's for the right cause. She usually wears bright jumpsuits when there is no need for stealth, but each of her suits can be reversed into the traditional ninja outfit. more will follow later (my npc's blew them out of the water :D )

I'm home not even 10 minutes when my dad lays the guilt trip on me.  "You know you could work during this break" "If you worked it would be better" "You won't be going to school much longer if you don't work" "I can't afford to pay your thousands of dollars for college".

I'm getting to the point where I am about to explode and verbally assault him.  I know things, and say things to him, that would really hurt him emotionally.  That's his real weak point, his emotions.  He tries to be tough, but that's only a physical facade(sp?).  He is mentally unstable and would probably break down if I really snapped and assaulted his fragile mind.  I need to get away, and I just got here.

Anyways, I shall persevere

Peace, Love, Empathy,

DraconicDrummer

"I never let schooling interfere with my education." 
-Mark Twain  

Ain't that the truth.  I've learned more in the past year out of class than in class.  While in class you can learn about classical psychology and "great" literature, it is the group of intellectuals you "hang out" with that teach you the most.  Debating religion and other topics that are considered taboo in school is an integral part of my education.  While I will say somethings are better learned in a classroom, modern politics are better learned by spending the day watching CNN while discussing what's going on in the world with those you trust.  Perhaps we should stop attending classes and pay better attention to the world arround us.

I'll get off my soap box now.

Peace, Love, Hillarity
DraconicDrummer

"We are the music makers, and we are the dreamers of the dream. Wandering by lone sea breakers, and sitting by desolate streams. World losers and world forsakers, for whom the pale moon gleams. Yet we are movers and the shakers of the world forever it seems." 
-Arthur O'Shaunessey  

Ok. The quote has no signifigant meaning, I just like it.

Several people have asked me if I wanted to go drink this weekend, specifically after the Arrowhead game. Yes, I've turned them all down, even those who offered to buy. Most have tried to question me on why I don't drink. Do I have something against social events? Am I a lightweight? Am I an alcoholic? The answer to all these questions are the same... NO In high school, I drank more than one man should. Being a man of enormous size, even as a high school freshmen, I could out drink most, if not all, of my peers, and I did so regularly. There were even days when I came to school intoxicated, and due to what I can only call a fluke of genetics, I don't get hangovers, so I was fine as the day went by, though I had to go to the bathroom frequently. This continued on for four years. In the last month of my Senior year in high school, a few tragic events happened that changed my life. First, I lost it while drunk. At a party, to celebrate our release from the hell we have suffered for four years, another drunk guy hit on my girlfriend (yes I had a girlfriend and we were very close, but that's a story for another day) while I was talking to her. I did ask him to quit it, but he continued for quite sometime. Eventually, he grabbed her chest and I snapped. I broke his nose, both his arms, a leg, and a couple of ribs. They just couldn't pull me off of him. Eventually, the few people I truly trusted stopped me from furthering this guys pain. He ended up in the hospital, we both blamed it as an accident when he "jumped off the roof of the house" and I did apologize to him. If you find this, which is doubtful, I'm still sorry Jacob, we were both drunk and what's done is done. I did set you up with that cheerleader though (now his wife), so I hope all is forgiven. The second traumatizing event that happened that month stunned not only me, but my entire class, school, and town. I close friend of mine was almost killed. He's lucky he didn't die. This 95 pound weakling was taking shot after shot of moonshine. Now, I know it's illegal, but out in the woods in the Ozark mountains, nobody is going to find you, let alone catch you doing something illegal. At 4 o'clock in the morning, his mom called me and said that he hadn't come home. I woke some others to start looking for him. I knew where he was. There is a small uninhabited cabin in the Mark Twain National Forest around my home town. We've been using it when we just needed to get away and there was a large supply of alcohol hidden there. I had heard about his girlfriend of 4 years cheating on him, so I knew where he would have been and what he would be doing. When I got to the cabin, he appeared to be passed out on the small cot in the cabin. By him was a small IBC root beer bottle, the glass ones that could be mistaken by beer bottles by the local police. That's when I had someone with a cell phone call an ambulance. In the root beer bottle was moonshine, and he had just drank 16 oz of it. He missed graduation because he now had permanent brain damage. Even though I now live in a different city, and go to college in a different part of the state, I still visit him over the breaks. Once he could have told you what note was sang or played while being in a different room, now he can barely remember my name, and I'm the one who visits him the most. So, yeah, I've quit drinking. I think I've made the right choice for now. Maybe when I'm actually legal to drink, I'll have a small drink every once in awhile, but not until then and maybe not till years later. This is the first time I've told anybody the true reasons I've quit drinking. I'm actually bawling my eyes out while I type this. Maybe someday I can talk to somebody about it face to face and not through a cold, impersonal computer, but I don't think my fragile psyche could take it. For Now and Always DraconicDrummer
